title: Itlachiayaque (Hack'EM)
data:
| \[   Itlachiayaque   *(No tile)* |                                                                                                                                                            |
| -------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Base item                        | [shield of reflection](/wiki/Shield_of_reflection "Shield of reflection")                                                                                  |
|                                  |                                                                                                                                                            |
| Affiliation                      | - [lawful](/wiki/Lawful "Lawful")
- [Archeologist](/wiki/Archeologist "Archeologist")
- [intelligent](/wiki/Intelligent_artifacts "Intelligent artifacts") |
|                                  |                                                                                                                                                            |
| When carried                     | * [ESP](/wiki/ESP "ESP")
* [half spell damage](/wiki/Half_spell_damage "Half spell damage")
* [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance")   |
| When worn                        | - [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection")                                                                                                              |
| When invoked                     | * [stinking cloud](/wiki/Scroll_of_stinking_cloud "Scroll of stinking cloud") (only controllable as Archeologist)                                          |
|                                  |                                                                                                                                                            |
| Base price                       | 3000 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                                                                                                                         |
| Weight                           | [66](/wiki/Weight "Weight")                                                                                                                                |

**Itlachiayaque** is the [Archeologist](/wiki/Archeologist "Archeologist") [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact") in [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), which adapts the artifact from [L's](/wiki/L_\(person\) "L (person)") [Itlachiayaque](/wiki/Itlachiayaque "Itlachiayaque") Patch against [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3"). It is the prize for completing the [Archeologist quest](/wiki/Archeologist_quest "Archeologist quest"), and is [lawful](/wiki/Lawful "Lawful") for generation purposes. Its [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") type is a [shield of reflection](/wiki/Shield_of_reflection "Shield of reflection") made of [gold](/wiki/Gold_\(material\) "Gold (material)").

## Generation

For Archeologists, the [Minion of Huhetotl](/wiki/Minion_of_Huhetotl "Minion of Huhetotl") is [always generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") Itlachiayaque.

## Description

Itlachiayaque confers confers [ESP](/wiki/ESP "ESP"), [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance") and [half spell damage](/wiki/Half_spell_damage "Half spell damage") while carried, and confers [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") as normal while worn. [Invoking](/wiki/Invoking "Invoking") Itlachiayaque causes a mass of [poison clouds](/wiki/Poison_cloud "Poison cloud") to generate, with the cloud centered on a non-Archeologist character, while an Archeologist can select the square to center the cloud on as with a [scroll of stinking cloud](/wiki/Scroll_of_stinking_cloud "Scroll of stinking cloud").

## Encyclopedia entry

Tezcatlipoca (Fiery Mirror) was undoubtedly the Jupiter of the  
Nahua pantheon. He carried a mirror or shield \[ Itlachiayaque ],  
from which he took his name, and in which he was supposed to see  
reflected the actions and deeds of mankind. The evolution of this  
god from the status of a spirit of wind or air to that of the  
supreme deity of the Aztec people presents many points of deep  
interest to students of mythology.

\[ The Myths of Mexico and Peru, by Lewis Spence ]

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Itlachiayaque_\(Hack%27EM\)\&action=edit)*

Itlachiayaque (Hack'EM)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
[   Itlachiayaque   (No tile)
Base item shield of reflection
Affiliation
  • lawful
  • Archeologist
  • intelligent
When carried
  • ESP
  • half spell damage
  • fire resistance
When worn
  • reflection
When invoked
  • stinking cloud
    (only controllable as Archeologist)
Base price 3000 zm
Weight 66

Itlachiayaque is the Archeologist quest artifact in Hack'EM, which adapts the artifact from L's Itlachiayaque Patch against NetHack 3.4.3. It is the prize for completing the Archeologist quest, and is lawful for generation purposes. Its base item type is a shield of reflection made of gold.

Generation

For Archeologists, the Minion of Huhetotl is always generated with Itlachiayaque.

Description

Itlachiayaque confers confers ESP, fire resistance and half spell damage while carried, and confers reflection as normal while worn. Invoking Itlachiayaque causes a mass of poison clouds to generate, with the cloud centered on a non-Archeologist character, while an Archeologist can select the square to center the cloud on as with a scroll of stinking cloud.

Encyclopedia entry

Tezcatlipoca (Fiery Mirror) was undoubtedly the Jupiter of the
Nahua pantheon. He carried a mirror or shield [ Itlachiayaque ],
from which he took his name, and in which he was supposed to see
reflected the actions and deeds of mankind. The evolution of this
god from the status of a spirit of wind or air to that of the
supreme deity of the Aztec people presents many points of deep
interest to students of mythology.

[ The Myths of Mexico and Peru, by Lewis Spence ]
